intro: Hieracium gothicum subsp. gothiciforme, commonly known as the Gothic dandelion, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. Native to Europe, this subspecies is often found in meadows and grasslands. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms from June to August. Its scientific name reflects its ornate, almost Gothic-like appearance, which has inspired its common name.
